pages.text: The Reactor is a multiblock machine whose primary job is to produce energy. A lot of it.$(br2)A multiblock machine is composed by many different blocks that you will place in the world next to each others.$(br2)To craft and power the Reactor you need Yellorium ingots, so go mine some Yellorite Ores and smelt them now.

To build your first Reactor you need to craft the following Basic Reactor blocks:$(br2)$(li)21x Casing$(li)1x Glass$(li)1x Controller$(li)1x Control Rod$(li)1x Fuel Rod$(li)1x Solid Access Port$(li)1x Active Forge Energy Power Tap$(br2)The Glass block is actually optional and can be replaced by another Casing block.

pages.title: Forge Power Tap
pages.text: Once you have crafted all the required blocks, you are ready to build your first Reactor.$(br2)Place the blocks in your world following this diagram:

If all goes well, when you place the last block the Reactor will form and you can now open the Controller interface by right-clicking on the Controller block.$(br2)If nothing happens, right click on any block you placed down: you will get an error message that should explain what the problem is. Once you have fixed it, you should have a formed Reactor or another error message waiting for you.

Now that your Reactor is ready, it's time to put some fuel in it.$(br2)Pick up more Yellorium ingots and right-click on the Solid Access Port. Set the Port to Inlet mode and place your ingots in the input slot.$(br2)The ingos will be quickly consumed by the Reactor and turned into fuel. If you used the Reactor Glass block, check the Fuel Rod now: it's full of fuel!
